Reviews.Title: “Just the basics”
Reviews.Author: Christiana0564
Reviews.Content: This is an aveage hotel located near a major highway. Rooms were clean and staff were pleasant. Picked this location because it was close to where I was working. If you are staying at this hotel, you definitely need a car. Bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper as you're right by the 401.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE AND HEARTLESS MANAGER”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa B
Reviews.Content: My mother is at the Scarborough General Hospital at the death bed of her husband. She's been staying in Downtown Toronto and commuting to the hospital everyday. I wanted to book her a hotel closer to the hospital and called this Best Western and spoke with the manager (10:30am Friday February 3rd 2012) who told me I could not pay for the room on my credit card unless I were going to be present at check in. I told him my mothers situation and asked if I could fill out a third party authorization form and fax or e-mail a front and back copy of my credit card and ID. He told me could only charge my credit card that way if it were a "business stay", not a "leisure stay" since my mom is at the hospital. I told him I'd like to re-book her reservation under "business stay", to which he said "oh yeah, what business?" and I replied "I'll pick any business in Scarborough" to which he said, "No you won't because I'll ask her for proof". I've canceled my reservation. I've made a reservation with Delta Toronto East who faxed me the third party authorization form with no problem. I can not express adequately my shock at the rude and heartless attitude of this best western manager. I hope this review deters you, the reader, from giving this establishment your business and money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and pleasant staff, but bed very uncomfortable and a later breakfast closure would be appreciated”
Reviews.Author: browngirl0011
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, uncomfortable beds!!!!! This is a very good hotel but the room we stayed in had a very uncomfortable bed and the breakfast ended at 9:30 which - because it was the holidays - was REALLY early - I missed it all but the last day of our stay because I could not get up early enough. It was the HOLIDAYS! The room service was good and very flexible. The road outside of the hotel was very slippery so be very careful when driving there during the winter months.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sylvie.mac
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of November. Normally when I go to Toronto we stay downtown at the Delta chelsea, but I picked this hotel primarily because it was very close to the Toronto Zoo, and we didn't have a car ( we took the train). So, to go to downtown, Yorkdale, Vaughn Mills, etc. we took the TTC everywhere, which was great. The check in was good, the room nice and clean, a good size. The bathroom was a good size and water pressure great. The hotel is right off the 401 but you really didn't hear any noise from outside. Staff was very nice. The only problem was that our fridge didn't work so on the second night I told the staff and they said if it couln't be fixed I'd have to switch rooms. Later that night fridge was still broken and we were checking out the next day, so it was pointless to switch. We did use the pool once, nice and quiet and clean, but a little cold! jacuzzi was nice, though. We did use the breakfast room every morning, the attendant was very nice and ensured everything was stocked. They had a waffle maker, bagels, toast, different kinds of eggs and sausage and pastries-the usual stuff, not really a big buffet, but really it was OK. If we were to come again to Toronto, we may stay here again, but only if it was to go to the zoo. Toronto is so big that it took a while to go from from the hotel to Downtown or whatever, like an hour and a half- that's using the subway! but then driving with a car, takes almost as long, plus you have to deal with parking, etc. Also, it's in a buisness area, so there's not a lot of places to go shop and eat, just the McDonald's down the street and the Keg. Scarborough Centre is nearby, though. It was a good hotel to stay at, but we may downtown again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: linus7104
Reviews.Content: High quality stay at affordable price. Great staff, clean rooms and a pool to boot. easy access from the 401 to Toronto, Wonderland and all the other sites.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Scarborough, Ontario”
Reviews.Author: Mark43
Reviews.Content: Everything went perfectly during our stay. This property is at the corner of Markham and the Highway 401 (very accessible). Very nicely maintained...guest rooms that made you feel at home and a friendly staff, eh! I would definitely stay here again. While in Toronto, I probably told 10 people that I met, what a SUPER place it was. Very quiet and peaceful. The only thing I would change is 'quicker' hot water on the 4th floor, and change up the complimentary breakfast menu. Thank you Cole for helping make our stay...just perfect, eh!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: nancyb52053
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this Scarborough hotel and would definitely go back. I had made a couple of special requests regarding my room and was not disappointed when I arrived with my family. The teens really enjoyed the pool and said it was very clean. The hot breakfast, included, was also very good. The room was very well appointed. Staff - very friendly and professional - was also very helpful at recommending nearby restaurants and local attractions. The only minor drawback was an uncomfortably mattress on the pullout couch. This is a great family or business hotel, with easy access to the Toronto Zoo and to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: jlee028
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in August 2011. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Very good soundproofing as well because our room was close to Hwy 401 and we did not hear any traffic noise. The location just off the 401 and Markham Road is very convenient and easy to find. Parking at the hotel is free and plentiful. There is not much within walking distance around the hotel except for a Keg Steakhouse, but the Scarborough Town Centre (large shopping mall) is only a few minutes drive away and Sheppard Avenue, a main road in Scarborough, is just on the other side of the 401. Breakfast is decent; there were scrambled eggs and sausage in the morning along with toast, croissants, muffins, danish and a selection of cold cereals. The one waffle-maker was a popular item, so there were consistent long line-ups for that. I would have liked to see a bit more fruit in the selection. On the first morning when we had breakfast, there was a plate of watermelon, but that went really fast. I never saw any more cut fruit during the rest of my stay there. Some bananas and apples were also available, but the bananas were never ripe enough. The breakfast room is also not very big, so unless I went early, there was often no seating there and I would have to bring breakfast back to the suite. There is a meeting room on the main floor that they use as an overflow seating area for breakfast. too. I would advise people to go down to breakfast early if possible (i.e. before 8:00 a.m.) to avoid lineups and get seating in the breakfast room. Overall, this was a good hotel and consistent with what I expected for Best Western. I would stay here again if I had to return to the Scarborough area again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: doyledOttawa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 4 or 5 times and we love it each time we visit! The rooms are very well appointed, including a microwave and mini fridge. Rooms are very clean, and the service is fantastic. The included breakfast is wonderful and a great way to start your day. The location is perfect, right off hwy 401, but no matter where you stay in the hotel, you never hear any noise from the highway. They offer free wifi in the hotel rooms, a lovely pool, sauna and whirlpool which is great for families or couples. Very close to the toronto zoo, about 1/2 hour away from the ontario science centre and about 45 minutes from downtown toronto. The prices are so reasonable for this hotel and we have always had a positive experience here. I really can't think of anything negative about this place. We love this hotel and will absolutely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “bedbugs, it was horrible !”
Reviews.Author: chafet
Reviews.Content: i visited recently this hotel . i had benn surprised by the presence of bedbugs in my room. my wife, children had their skins hurt by bedbugs. the staff of this hotel did not care too much, the maximum they could do is to give me another room at another level but i continued to be awaked during all the night letting the light on to avoid to have amssive attack by these bedbugs. Even the carpets in this hotels are too dirty. i searched on the net to find if there is someone who spoke about the same thing and i fortunately i found one person who reported the same thing in 2010. if you want to book in that hotel you have to think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing particularly appealing”
Reviews.Author: MaxEntrophy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel owing to a soccer tournament in the area. We stayed in a so-called "executive suite" which, in our case, was a room with two queen beds and a sitting area. The room is pretty spartan and aging as one would expect for a hotel at this price point but it was relatively clean. We also found our room stuffy and damp, with a mild odor which I can not place. Air conditioning was via a noisy window/wall unit. On the upside, there is free wireless internet and breakfast. There is a fair amount of choice for the free breakfast but we did not eat there; instead we ate breakfast at the Tim Horton's outlet which is about 2 minutes away by car. Personally I would not stay at this hotel again but there were other soccer team parents who were quite satisfied with their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Plumbing the hotels toilets and terrible customer service after the fact”
Reviews.Author: allie-gator
Reviews.Content: I have NEVER made a complaint to a hotel in my life until now! My senior citizen mother, my children and myself stayed at the Best Western Plus executive inn at 38 estate drive in Scarborough for two nights in June 2011. When we got to our room my son urinated in the toilet and flushed it, no toilet paper used and it started to overflow. I called down to the front desk and the employee advised me I would have to come and get the plunger and take care of it myself. I asked if he was kidding and he said they are a limited service hotel and there is no one to assist me. I asked if we could move rooms and he said there were no more available. I went down got the plunger and fixed the problem. Of course it happened in the middle of the night as well, but I left it until the morning. The next day I spoke to the front desk and advised them that this had to be taken care of and was not acceptable. The employee agreed and said they would have maintenance fix it before we got back to the hotel or they would put us in an equivalent room. Promises... Promises. We got back from a long day of sightseeing and the first flush of the toilet it overflows. I called down and said it was promised to be fixed, it has not been so I now want to be changed rooms. â€œI am sorry but we do not have any more of your type of rooms, but you can come down and get the plunger as we are a limited service hotelâ€�. What was I to do? I went down and got the plunger. I said to the employee I was not happy and she said she understood and she would not be happy either. She said that she would take 10% off our bill. I told her that that is not the least bit acceptable. I asked her why the toilet was not fixed and she said there is a note on the file saying it was. I am assuming they unplugged the toilet and did not fix the actual problem. I told her I wanted to speak to a manager and she advised there was none on duty but â€œColeâ€� will call me on Monday. Fine, up I went with my plunger to fix the toilet. On check out I spoke to the front desk again about my situation advising them I have stayed in a lot of hotels and never once had a complaint and I did not feel we should be charged for our stay at this hotel. I can take a lot, but having to plunge their toilets crosses over the line. She agreed but said it was not something she should do and I was to speak with the manager Cole. I asked if there was a note for him to call me, she said yes. Monday came, Monday went. Not surprisingly no call from Cole. I called at 4pm but of course Cole was no longer available. I asked if the message was given to Cole and the front desk advised it had been. I have searched Best Westerns web site top to bottom and nowhere does it state they are a limited service hotel and guests have to do their own plunging. In fact the web site says; â€œThe friendly staff at the BEST WESTERN PLUS Executive Inn is ready to greet you with a smile and provide a comfortable and memorable stay. Make a reservation today and save!â€� Comfortable .... NO Memorable.... VERY, but not for the right reasons. So finally Cole emails me back and appologizes and offers a 30% discont to be refunded to the credit card. I had cc'd Best Western International as well and they were great. They sent me a $50 gift card that can be used at another location. I thought that plus the 30% was sufficiant enough to stop fighting with them. I emailed Cole back and told him although I did not think his 30% was enough but would tell my Mom to expect it on her credit card. I asked my Mom if it was there last week and she said no. I called Cole and left a message as well sent an email. NO RESPONSE.... called again and sent another email. Cole advised because I told him I was not completly satisfied he would not be issuing a refund and that was the end of the conversation. I emailed him back and said I wanted his supervisor and he responded with "As previously stated no further actions will be taken at this time." So a short story long... stay at this hotel if you want to plung your own toilet, have no towels available at the pool or in the gym and have many broken promises. Best Western International has been great. I have stayed at many Best Westerns and never ever had this issue. I have lodged a complaint with the BBB

Reviews.Title: “Good value, avg exp. Have slept better elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: hrmelness
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 1 night with my boyfriend. We stayed in a king room and immediately noticed the dated decor, mostly due to the granny floral accents. The coffee maker, ice bucket and drinking glasses (thankfully packaged in plastic) were in the bathroom other than the usual spot outside on the desk â€“ This also turned me off, even when I donâ€™t usually use them. The king bed we had was uncomfortably stiff (firm mattress I suppose) and only 3 standard-size pillows were provided, all of which felt lumpy to me. Needless to say, I didnâ€™t sleep too well. The hot breakfast offered in the morning is limited and what little is provided goes fast but that was because we came downstairs late (close to 10am) and the kitchen mustâ€™ve halted production by then. The dining room is small and fills up quite fast. Even though itâ€™s an Executive Inn, I noticed lots of families at breakfast. The heater/AC in the room is quite loud, but that helped drown out noise from the hallway. Front desk service is average on the customer service front, not particularly friendly; just process-in process out. I wouldnâ€™t recommend staying here for more than 1-2 nights, but for an overall experience it was average and for the amount we paid it was admittedly a decent value. The hotel did have a nice-looking pool and hot tub, which we wouldâ€™ve used had it not been for the family that took over both. Pro -King room is spacious -High speed internet access & wifi (need to use a code though) -Breakfast included -Free overnight parking -Pool, hot tub & fitness room. Also a small business centre. -Front desk says they donâ€™t allow room parties (we stayed Halloween weekend) Con -Dated decor, could use a refresh -Uncomfortable king bed, cheap on the pillows -Poor soundproofing; I could hear when people were in the hallway

Reviews.Title: “What an AWFUL EXPERIENCE!!!”
Reviews.Author: ForgetThatPlace
Reviews.Content: We arrived late evening and checked in to what we thought was a room with a Queen bed...what we got was a room with two double beds. I went down to the desk clerk to ask why our room was with two doubles and right away he was so rude and stated that we knew what we were getting. As if it makes sense that a couple would get seperate beds. He then insulted me and said we either shut up more or less or we would get kicked out. After trying, fruitlessly to resolve the situation, I asked for a refund. I did not want to sleep there nor even be there in the presence of such rude staff. I was offended and insulted when all I wanted was what we asked for. The manager was absolutley careless and was even worse than the desk clerk. No refunded was given and we left. And they dare say that we used the room and wanted to get away with it for free! Meanwhile they took our money and we received nothing in return. And we now have to go through trying to get it back and beleive it or not the head office says there is nothing they can do about it because they are all independently owned, and also, they said we have to deal with that manager! No way, we already tryed that. The most horrible hotel ever and the reason is the people who run it. So please, please...if you think at staying at this hotel of theifs, think again! Go stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: JMMAES
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, average rooms, Clean tho... Front desk was very polite and helpful. Rest of the staff were very rude and it seemed like we bothered them. Breakfast is minimal, and u cant serve urself, must be done by a worker which I found annoying. Quiet area

Reviews.Title: “Meet our needs”
Reviews.Author: Bazee
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights. Rooms where clean and tidy. Unfortunately it was spring break and a young girls ice hockey team along with their parents where staying at the hotel. This meant kids were running around everywhere and sometimes blocked the hall. Not really the hotels fault. Breakfast as a result was really busy. They should move the waffle maker to the end of the breakfast area as people making waffles would block people wanting to get access to other breakfast items.

Reviews.Title: “Great service! Clean & well maintained!”
Reviews.Author: skittlezz55
Reviews.Content: Arrived late night on Sunday for business. Unfortunately, I arrived before my luggage did so I was without toiletries and my laptop. Staff was extremely helpful and sympathetic. They provided me with all the items I needed to get through the night and notified me as soon as my luggage arrived the next day. Their business center helped me stay connected with my company and my family. The room was very clean. I was worried about the possible noise from the highway, but I was not disturbed at all. I will surely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST WESTERN??? WORST WESTERN!!!”
Reviews.Author: baldjon
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we noticed our room was a little "lack-lustre". There was a big crack in the wall, the skirt on the sofa had a massive tear on it and the bathroom floor behind the door had never seen a mop...ever. Our room was ice cold so we put the heat on. There was this awful grinding noise when the fan moved. We put up with it a while but then had to do something. We were switched to a different room which was totally fine. We met our colleague the next morning and she couldn't sleep all night because she was in a room next to the maintenance room and there was constant banging all night. She went to the front desk and they switched her to another room as well. After a long day of walking (you're in TO, what else do you do?), we arrived back at the hotel and saw 2 kids in the hottub-pool area and decided to go in the hottub to ease a few aching bones. We went up to change and came down to a dark pool and keys that would not open the door. I went to the front desk and asked if the pool was closed (supposed to be open until 10pm, was only 7:30), they said it was "unclean". There goes that idea of a nice soak. I get back to my room and the front desk called my colleague to offer 15% off our rooms for tonight for the inconvenience. Nice gesture, I guess. I have to say that the staff was great throughout all of our misfortunes at this hotel, but they have a hard road ahead of them if they continue to work here. How many other complaints did they get if both of the people in my party had issues with their stay? I would not recommend this hotel to anyone except the large families on my floor who took up 3 rooms to house all of them. By the way, it was really fun to hear the kids go back and forth between rooms and hear the young kids up to at least 11pm. Next time I will pay $20 more a night to have a true 3 star hotel. This place is more 2 star than anything. The ad brags that this hotel is the newest in the area. It seems about 8 years old and in need of maintenance and updating already.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: carlitguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week of November. While the hotel is on Canada's busiest highway, we never knew it in our room. The room was extremly quiet and spotless. The cleaning staff does a great job. We had a flat screen in our room. There is free internet in the lobby and while the hotel was busy we never had a problem getting on one of the two computers. The front staff were excelllent with free cookies and newspapers. We really enjoyed the free breakfast which is one of the best we have ever had included in the price. It consists of fruit, cereal, juice, pastries, waffles, beverages, yogurt and more. You do need a car to use this hotel, as it is out in the boondocks. I imagine you could get downtown on the TTC from here but it would take a bit of time. We paid under a $100 per night and would stay here again. A bonus was the little Caribbean take out shop on the corner. They had huge portions for a vey low price. It was excellent. Also, there are a number of restarants in the area and it is close to the shopping at Scarborough Town Centre which had a WalMart that came in handy. Dean in Canada

Reviews.Title: “pleasant, clean and roomy”
Reviews.Author: CCR1138
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights, and I found the hotel to be quite comfortable. I would definitely recommend it if you have your own car and want a nice place at a good price. THE GOOD: Our double-queen room was spacious and comfortable. There was a fridge, microwave, coffee-maker, and free wi-fi. The pool area is very nice, perfect for our teenager to burn off some energy. Their business center was small but adequate for checking email, etc. THE BAD: The hotel is a long drive from downtown. The complimentary breakfast didn't include protein of any sort, so we skipped it. There is no wired internet connection in the rooms, but you can use the business center if you need secure access. THE UGLY: Nothing to report -- overall, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel on the 401”
Reviews.Author: RedDust
Reviews.Content: Stopped at this hotel on our way back home. Since everything was packed closer to downtown Toronto, we gave them a call and took the only room left. The room size was ok, but everything was clean and comfortable. No problems with Internet access either. Pool area, while not used, seemed very nice. Morning breakfast was ok, but the room was very full and we had to line-up for a few items such as waffles (only 1 waffle maker) and toasts (only 1 toaster). Coffee wasn't great. Staff was nice. This hotel lacks luggage carts as well, and around 2 hours before check-out time, none were available which made me take 4 trips to take everything down. without ever seeing a cart being available. Then again, some selfish people were probably keeping them in their room for later use... Location is somewhat close to the Don Valley Parkway which brings you downtown, but if you want to avoid Toronto's nightmare traffic better stay downtown. This is just a decent side-of-major-highway hotel, nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: maestrowawa
Reviews.Content: We had to drag our luggage up and down several times before we finally got into our room. When we got to our first room, I swiped the keycard and discovered that the room was occupied, with other people's belongings. I hate to think that someone could walk into my room and take away my valuables because the hotel was not careful while giving out rooms. The staff gave us another room, but before we reached that room, the staff came running to us and said that the room might also be occupied... so down we went again with our luggage. After ten minutes of waiting, they gave us another room which they claimed was the only room left that has two queen beds. The room smelt really bad, and we couldn't leave the window open to air out because it is on the first floor. We were extremely unhappy about it. I asked to move to another room. This took another 10 minutes. I think what's frustrating was that I kept getting email "welcoming" us to the hotel -"looking forward to your stay", etc. But when we got there, the room was not kept aside for us. And after a few mishaps, I thought, had I been the management, I would have upgraded the guests to perhaps another catagory of rooms to solve the problem. Instead, the front desk had us dragging our stuff up and down the noisy elevator (that's scary too!) several times. I had stayed with this Best Western twice before. But I would seriously consider staying elsewhere next time I visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “NOT for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: jimod99
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel with the zoo package, we have 2 children aged 2 and 8 months. We were extremely surprised that the children were banned from the pool, as they are "diaper age" have these people never heard of swim diapers????? Our kids love to play in the pool and our 2 year old, who has been taking swimming lessons for a year, could not understand why she wasn't allowed in the pool, especially as this was the third hotel we had been in on a 10 day road trip and she had been in the pool in both others, incidently not Best Westerns. If this is a general Best Western rule we would certainly not stay in one again. In the breakfast room in the mormning I asked the member of staff on duty for some water to make up the babys cereal, I was gruffly told "theres a drinks fountain outside"!!!! We did find the staff unhelpful. As there are many hotels in this price range if you have very small children I'd advise you to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: jiopr
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious, had two queen beds, a sofa, desk, fridge, microwave and free wireless internet access. There were some signs of wear in the room but nothing serious or bad. The shower head was strong. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Next to the hotel there was a Keg restaurant and a McDonalds. The Scarborough Town Centre mall was a five minute drive down the street. Breakfast was complimentary. The offerings included bagels, toast, boiled eggs, waffles, apples, juice and coffee. We would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ambience”
Reviews.Author: ondwargaurav
Reviews.Content: The Ambienec e was amazing, however, the toiletories could have been better, the internet connection was giving some problem.

Reviews.Title: “expectations met”
Reviews.Author: Billyp27
Reviews.Content: We stayed over our spring break weekend for 4 days while visiting relatives. There was a youth basketball tourney taking place in the area and our hotel hosted a few of the teams. Although the hotel was busy, we never noticed any noise challenges in the hallways. The guest lounge was very busy every morning, but that was to be expected. It was maintained constantly by staff and every table that emptied was quickly cleared and cleaned for the next guest. The pool area was small, but clean. Every morning while passing by the housekeeping staff we always were smiled at and greeted. VERY impressive and a great touch of class by the staff to make you feel welcome. There was adequete parking and even though we were beside a freeway, we did not notice any noise. The only negative was the outdated "business centre" or 2 computers. They were extremely outdated. For a 6 yr old hotel, i bet these were 8 years old! I could never get the printer to work, and i'm no novice.

Reviews.Title: “Budget friendly, good for families”
Reviews.Author: Standardrose
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Toronto for 2 days and 1 night and we had a car to drive down to Niagara Falls so it was no problem to drive to this hotel. I had found it difficult to find a suitable hotel for 2 adults and 3 children in Toronto, and our preference was for 1 room, and this hotel met the criteria. The room was spacious, clean and well appointed. It had lots of room for luggage too. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast too. Despite being quite close to a busy road the room was quite, the beds were comfortable and we had a good night sleep. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast too. Being in a light industrial area is not the nicest location, but we did not mind as we were only there for 1 night. The hotel had lots of free car parking. It was quick and easy to drive to downtown Toronto the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “great one!”
Reviews.Author: srinadh0
Reviews.Content: Didnot want parking hassles and downtown chaos. So chose this one and I wasnt disappointed. + It is very clean; calm. + close to lot of good restaurents + great complimentary breakfast + free and plenty of parking + took only 20 minutes to CN tower on a sunday morning at 9:30am - TV was not upto the hotel. It was old; noteven flatscreen. Frontdesk was courteous and quick. Room was really great. has coffee maker and even has small refrigirator and a microwave oven!! Plenty of parking. I wanted to goto south-indian restaurent as we can hardly find one in Montreal. This is 15 mins from Saravana Bhavan. Though I wasnot much impressed with quality and taste of Saravana Bhavan, I have no regrets with the hotel. Took 20 minutes to CN tower; CN tower is okay; didnt feel any exhileration. What irritated us was there were no proper directions on where to start and where/what to look for. It could have been better. Took hippo bus tour; which was really cool. Though it is bit costlier, I feel it is worth it. One sour note was: In the morning, I needed another towel for my kid. When I call the frontdesk, instead of offering to send the towel to the room, the receptionist asked me to come down to pick one!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine”
Reviews.Author: americantraveler080
Reviews.Content: It was very clean and looked like it was built recently. While we didn't use the swimming pool or the hot tub they looked quite clean. Breakfast was nothing to write home about but it was adequate and filling. The furniture in the rooms looked very new and was in great condition. The only minor problem I found with the place was that it was far from a subway station which is really the only way to get to the downtown area in a short amount of time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rate, very clean”
Reviews.Author: bytautas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 20 minutes from the CN tower in TO. It's very clean, the pool and hot tub area is very clean and inviting. They have a breakfast room that is included and it is just nice rather than searching for a breakfast place. Each room has a refriderator and the rooms are a nice size. Down the street is a large shopping centre and movie theatre. Very nice place to stay, if touring TO

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Executive Inn
